defaultCourse1.title: Introduction to Informatics
defaultCourse1.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers concepts of problem, algorithm, and program, basic data structures, and object-oriented programming, which match TUM's course requirements. However, it lacks coverage on concurrent programming and threads which are part of TUM's curriculum.

defaultCourse2.title: Fundamentals of Programming (Exercises & Laboratory)
defaultCourse2.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers basic data structures, recursion, and object-oriented programming, which match TUM's course. It lacks depth in concurrency and its application which TUM includes as part of this module.

defaultCourse3.title: Introduction to Computer Organization and Technology - Computer Architecture
defaultCourse3.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers microprocessors and basic computer architecture but lacks thorough knowledge about instruction set architectures and advanced architectural patterns like Von-Neumann architecture, which are covered at TUM.

defaultCourse4.title: Introduction to Software Engineering
defaultCourse4.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers system and object design, software development, testing, and engineering methods, matching all the core competencies of TUM's course.

defaultCourse5.title: Operating Systems and System Software
defaultCourse5.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers concurrency, synchronization, and resource management which match TUM's course focus on operating systems decomposition and low-level programming.

defaultCourse6.title: Fundamentals of Algorithms and Data Structures
defaultCourse6.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course efficiently covers data structures, algorithmic problems, hashing, sorting, which completely align with TUM's requirements.

defaultCourse7.title: Fundamentals of Databases
defaultCourse7.explanation_recommendation: Applicant's course covers SQL, database design, transaction management, which covers all aspects detailed in TUM's course.

defaultCourse8.title: Computer Networking and IT Security
defaultCourse8.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course addresses networking layers and some security protocols but does not entirely cover topics like intrusion detection and full coverage of cryptography as included in TUM's course.

defaultCourse9.title: Information Theory and Theoretical Informatics
defaultCourse9.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers formal languages, computability, decision problems, and complexity theory, matching TUM's essential topics closely.

defaultCourse10.title: Introduction to Signal Processing
defaultCourse10.explanation_recommendation: The applicant did not cover any signal processing content that matches TUM's course.

defaultCourse11.title: Foundations of Cyber-Physical Systems
defaultCourse11.explanation_recommendation: There are no topics in the applicant's curriculum that intersect with TUM's cyber-physical systems prerequisites.

defaultCourse12.title: Enterprise Architecture Management and Reference Models
defaultCourse12.explanation_recommendation: No relevant topics from the applicant's courses meet the enterprise architecture concepts and methods covered in TUM's curriculum.

defaultCourse13.title: Business Process Management
defaultCourse13.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's curriculum does not cover business process principles, methodologies, and IT interactions as detailed in TUM’s course.

defaultCourse14.title: Discrete Structures
defaultCourse14.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers set theory, propositional logic, and graph theory but lacks combinatorics and algebraic structures which are key components in TUM's course.

defaultCourse15.title: Linear Algebra
defaultCourse15.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers matrix calculus and vector spaces but lacks comprehensive coverage of determinants, eigenvalues, and more complex linear mappings as covered at TUM.

defaultCourse16.title: Calculus
defaultCourse16.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's calculus course extensively covers differential and integral calculus, approximation methods which overlap entirely with TUM's curriculum.

defaultCourse17.title: Discrete Probability Theory
defaultCourse17.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course thoroughly covers probability spaces, distributions, and statistical applications, matching those taught in TUM's course.
